distributions.name: Uniform1
distributions.description: The uniform distribution represents a range of equally likely values between a minimum and maximum.

distributions.name: StandardUniform1
distributions.description: A special case of the uniform distribution with a fixed range of [0, 1].

distributions.name: StandardNormal1
distributions.description: The standard normal distribution is a normal distribution with a mean of 0 and a standard deviation of 1.

parameters.name: Standard Deviation
parameters.description: Standard deviation of the normal distribution (1)

distributions.name: Normal1
distributions.description: The normal distribution models data with a specified mean and standard deviation.

distributions.name: Normal2
distributions.description: Similar to Normal1, but the context may differ based on application (e.g., specific priors or model structure).

distributions.name: Normal3
distributions.description: Same as Normal1 but tailored for a different use case.

distributions.name: LogNormal1
distributions.description: Models a variable whose logarithm follows a normal distribution.

distributions.name: LogNormal2
distributions.description: A variant of LogNormal1 with different usage context or implementation specifics.

distributions.name: Bernoulli1
distributions.description: Represents a binary outcome (success/failure) based on a fixed probability.

distributions.name: Bernoulli2
distributions.description: Similar to Bernoulli1, but may use logits instead of probabilities.

parameters.name: Logit
parameters.description: Log-odds of the probability, where p = exp(logit_p) / (1 + exp(logit_p))

distributions.name: Beta1
distributions.description: Models continuous values between 0 and 1, often for proportions.

distributions.name: BetaBinomial1
distributions.description: Combines the beta and binomial distributions for over-dispersed binomial data.

parameters.name: Alpha
parameters.description: Shape parameter of the beta distribution

parameters.name: Beta
parameters.description: Shape parameter of the beta distribution

distributions.name: Binomial1
distributions.description: Describes the number of successes in a fixed number of trials.

parameters.name: Probability of Success
parameters.description: Probability of success for each trial

distributions.name: Binomial2
distributions.description: Similar to Binomial1, but may accept logits instead of probabilities.
